CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in Table 1 , the optimized devices based on P1 showed a PCE of 3.1% with a V oc of 0.97 V , a J sc of 6.7 mA / cm^2 , and an FF = 0.47.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| P1 |

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions "P1" as the material that the optimized devices are based on. Therefore, "P1" is the only material name entity in this paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: As shown in Table 1 , the optimized devices based on P1 showed a PCE of 3.1% with a V oc of 0.97 V , a J sc of 6.7 mA / cm^2 , and an FF = 0.47.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V oc |
| J sc |
| FF |

These entities are properties mentioned in the context of the optimized devices. PCE stands for power conversion efficiency, V oc is open-circuit voltage, J sc is short-circuit current density, and FF is fill factor.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph, all of the identified entities are material properties. Here is the updated Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V oc |
| J sc |
| FF |

These entities are all properties related to the performance of the optimized devices. PCE stands for power conversion efficiency, V oc is open-circuit voltage, J sc is short-circuit current density, and FF is fill factor.
